title: Matchsafe, "Green Glass", 1896–97
markings: Illegible maker's mark, lion passant, date letter gothic "W", anchor, all stamped on outside of silver collar. STERLING stamped on reverse collar side. Lion passant and date letter "W" also stamped on underside of lid.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
dimensions: Overall: 5.1 x 4 x 1.5 cm (2 x 1 9/16 x 9/16 in.)
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, rounded sides and curved top, body made of transparant green glass, silver collar wrapped around upper edge, where it meets silver lid. Lid hinged on side, at point where it meets collar. Striker incised in glass in diamond pattern on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Green Glass", 1896–97.
1896–97. Glass, silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-1183.
